questions.clue: This Jamaican sprinter holds the world record for the 100 meters with a time of 9.58 seconds.
With 23 Grand Slam singles titles, she holds the record for the most in the Open Era for women.
This athlete scored an unprecedented 100 points in a single NBA game in 1962.
In 2016, this swimmer became the most decorated Olympian of all time, with a total of 28 medals.
This country holds the record for the most FIFA World Cup titles, having won it 5 times as of 2023.
This 'Wuthering Heights' singer topped the UK charts at just 19 years old.
In 'Running Up That Hill,' Kate Bush explores the desire to swap roles in this type of partnership.
Kate Bush's song 'Babooshka' tells the story of a wife testing her husband's fidelity using this method.
The 1985 album 'Hounds of Love,' featuring the track 'Cloudbusting,' was inspired by this unique dreamer and inventor.
Kate Bush's influence extends to modern artists, including this 'Chapel Roan' singer-songwriter known for her eclectic style.

categories.name: Famous Comedy Sketches: From Chappelle to Now

questions.clue: In this famous Chappelle's Show sketch, Dave Chappelle portrays a blind man who is unaware of his own race.
This Key & Peele sketch features a substitute teacher who hilariously mispronounces students' names, including A-A-Ron.
In a Saturday Night Live sketch, Kate McKinnon and Kenan Thompson portray these sports commentators hilariously covering a basketball game.
This Chappelle's Show sketch involves Chappelle playing Prince in a basketball game with Charlie Murphy, famously concluding with pancakes.
In a modern sketch from 'I Think You Should Leave', a character becomes obsessed with a TV show that features an awkward focus on this British singer-songwriter.
In Greek mythology, this winged horse sprang from the blood of Medusa when she was slain by Perseus.
In Norse mythology, this creature is a giant wolf and the son of Loki, destined to kill Odin during Ragnarok.
This creature from Japanese folklore is a supernatural entity that can shapeshift, often into a beautiful woman; its name means 'fox'.
Known in Celtic mythology, this creature is often depicted as a mischievous fairy or sprite, sometimes called a 'little spirit'.
In Slavic folklore, this dragon-like creature has three heads and is often associated with destructive storms.
This portable music player, released by Apple in 2001, revolutionized the way people listen to music on the go.
In 1983, this digital protocol was introduced to enable electronic musical instruments to communicate with each other.
Kate Bush was one of the first artists to use this software, known for its Fairlight CMI capabilities, in her albums.
This music streaming service, launched in 2008, changed the industry by offering millions of songs on demand.
In 1982, this digital audio format was introduced, allowing for high-quality sound storage and the eventual birth of the compact disc.

final.clue: In 1985, this then-unknown artist, known for her ethereal voice, performed at the closing ceremony of an event that had its first female marathon winner.
